page.title: 03Mining in Denaby and Cadeby
page.content: For over a century{mining}has been the major, basic industry in the area, with collieries in Denaby (1866) and Cadeby (1894) providing jobs for many men and school-leavers. By 1935 5,000 men were employed at the two pits, linking most families with the industry. In the last two decades, however, the two mines have had a{decreasing role}in the community. Denaby lost its pit in 1969; Cadeby Colliery, now with a workforce of less than 500, will be added to the list of pit closures within two years, resulting in more {redundancies}to add to the area's already high rate of unemployment. This is causing much antagonism, coming immediately after the recent {industrial action}against pit closures in the country.
